normalised: Load shedding, or scheduled power outages, has been a recurring theme in India for years. Remember back in the day, during the nineties? normalised: So, what is the deal? Why does this happen? Well, the most common reason is a simple imbalance: demand exceeds supply. Imagine everyone in Mumbai switching on their A C s at three P M on a hot day. The power grid gets overloaded, and to prevent a total system collapse, the electricity board (like Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited - M S E D C L) has to temporarily cut off power to certain areas. Think of it as a pressure release valve for the national grid.
